trans-unit.source: Provides a service that is used during save and write operations to input an object and return a XAML name.

This service is only relevant for a save path operation, such as when a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlWriter> serializes an attributed value converter usage, and the type converter or value serializer supports serialization.
A <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter> does not provide the service in its service context.

A type converter or value serializer can access this service by using an available schema context as a service provider and then obtaining the <xref:System.Xaml.IXamlNameProvider> service that is implemented in that context.

For more information, see [Type Converters and Markup Extensions for XAML](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/type-converters-and-markup-extensions-for-xaml.md) and [Service Contexts Available to Type Converters and Markup Extensions](~/docs/framework/xaml-services/service-contexts-available-to-type-converters-and-markup-extensions.md).
To correctly use XAML-defined names, you may also need to obtain information about the acting XAML namescope and the <xref:System.Windows.Markup.INameScope> value that represents it.
Retrieves the XAML name of the specified object.
The default .NET Framework XAML Services implementation relies on a XAML schema context that can report the object names being used in the runtime object graph.
The object to get the name for.
The XAML name value of the requested object.
